page.title: 04East Farleigh School
page.content: East Farleigh School is a County, co-educational school taking children of primary age. The present building is the fourth school to serve the village, having opened in 1956. The site was previously occupied by a wooden building which burned down on Coronation Night 1953. Because the new school was built on the same site, it adopted the emblem of the phoenix and a concrete phoenix can be seen on the outside of the building. Because of the widespread nature of the village, some children have a considerable distance to travel to the school, which also serves parts of neighbouring villages. A feature of the school is the Friday afternoon {ceilidh} at which staff and children join together to share musical and dramatic performances.
